Issues.Title: Fix DrtFlowLayout
Issues.Body: DrtFlowLayout is failing because of a behavior change (bug fix) between .NETFx and .NETCore.  When double d is between -0.001 and 0, d.ToString("F", Invariant) returns "0.00" in .NETFx, but "-0.00" in .NETCore.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fix DrtFlowLayout" (#1150)

Issues.Title: remove test infrastructure dependency on running as admin
Issues.Body:
This stemmed from #816, but we determined the task to remove the dependency on running as admin will take too much time, so it's getting a dedicated task. 

Most of the functionality that requires running as admin can probably just be removed, such as JIT debugger registration. I personally don't see much value in that functionality, i can use gflags to do that if i want.  There is a lot of ETW logging as well, and we'll need to handle that gracefully so that we can maintain this, although I doubt anyone will use it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "remove test infrastructure dependency on running as admin" (#1149)

Issues.Title: Fix DrtNavigationEvents
Issues.Body: DrtNavigationEvents is failing because of #1147.  It is getting more NavigationProgress events than it expects.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fix DrtNavigationEvents" (#1148)

Issues.Title: BAML streams can be longer than in .NET 4.8.  This can cause more NavigationProgress events.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`) 3.0 Preview8
* Windows version: (`winver`) any
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
Compiling most XAML files in .NET Core produces a longer BAML stream than in .NET Framework.  This is because Core's "SDK builds" add implicit references to assemblies that contribute to the default namespace, which then appear as AssemblyInfo records in the BAML stream;  these records don't appear in Framework unless the assemblies were explicitly referenced.   For example, a typical simple app's Core BAML includes records for "System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon" and "WindowsFormsIntegration" that don't appear in the corresponding Framework BAML.  The extra records, plus references to them from elsewhere in the BAML, increases the length of the BAML stream by about 200 bytes.

This obviously results in larger file sizes and a perf impact (for reading the extra bytes), but that is admittedly small.  It doesn't cause an assembly-load impact at runtime;  the extra assemblies are not loaded if they're never used.  One less obvious impact is that loading the BAML can result in raising more [NavigationProgress](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.navigation.navigationservice.navigationprogress?view=netframework-4.8) events, as these are purely a function of the length of the BAML stream.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BAML streams can be longer than in .NET 4.8.  This can cause more NavigationProgress events." (#1147)

Issues.Title: How to resolve resource keys from embedded xaml files?
Issues.Body:
In #865 the xaml theme files were embedded into their theme assemblies to allow tools like VS/Blend to copy them for editing the templates.

I wanted to take a look and compared the current nightly build against the xaml files delivered with VS and noticed that the embedded resources did not provide named keys, for example

*Reference xaml installed with Visual Studio:*
```xaml
<SolidColorBrush x:Key="Button.Pressed.Border" Color="#FF2C628B" />
```
*Embedded resource xaml:*
```xaml
<SolidColorBrush x:Key="Ö" Color="#FF2C628B" />
```

How are Visual Studio / Blend resolving these IDs to resource keys when copying a template (I'd like to provide similar logic in my own msbuild-based tooling), or is this a bug and the wrong xaml files got embedded?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "How to resolve resource keys from embedded xaml files?" (#1146)

Issues.Title: Fix failure in DrtFixedEdit
Issues.Body:
DrtFixedEdit is failing because we are currently trying to read the scheme of a relative uri here:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/3a428625dfd907dcae7540f3cb4d0be2f90a3c30/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/PresentationFramework/System/Windows/Documents/FixedPage.cs#L618

This failure was introduced due to changes that were made to the above `if` statement here:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/969/files#diff-d6cd62f214719773a7a26ab93a0235b8

The failure was introduced by removing the `CanNavigateToUri` method, which was blocking the execution of the following `inputUri.Scheme` statement for relative URIs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fix failure in DrtFixedEdit" (#1141)

Issues.Title: Fix for Relative Uri's in Flowdocument being broken
Issues.Body:
Issue #1141 

This test was failing because we were trying to read the scheme of a relative URI (which was throwing an exception). Removed this statement as the check should have been removed as part of the changes that were made here: https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/969/files#diff-d6cd62f214719773a7a26ab93a0235b8

Ran a full DRT test pass on this change for verification.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix for Relative Uri's in Flowdocument being broken" (#1140)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fix and re-enable Control Area Feature tests" (#1134)

Issues.Title: WPF should not show the touch keyboard for read-only fields
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 4.7.1+
* Windows version: (`winver`): RS1+
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

 **Problem description:**
WPF uses direct calls to `InputPane.TryShow` via `TipTsfHelper` when the focused control implements the text UIA pattern, UIA is already loaded, and if the OS is >= RS1.
This means that even if the exposed `TextPattern` is marked read-only, WPF will request the KB to show.

What is actually needed is a finer grained set of conditions.
* Don't call TryShow if the `TextPattern` implementation declares it is read-only
* Don't call TryShow if the focus tracking for the touch KB does not use UIA, but uses TSF (RS3+, but this needs confirmation).

This can be mitigated in later OSes (RS3+) by setting the AppContext flag `DisableImplicitTouchKeyboardInvocation`.  This stops WPF from calling `InputPane.TryShow` but the KB focus tracking and invocation will still work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF should not show the touch keyboard for read-only fields" (#1133)

Issues.Title: Removing support for `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode and `restrictDeserialization`
Issues.Body:
Related:
 - https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/1131
 - https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/38760


Harden the codebase by removing support for `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode and `restrictDeserialization` near https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/search?l=C%23&q=binaryformatter&type=
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Removing support for `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode and `restrictDeserialization`" (#1132)

Issues.Title: Remove BinaryFormatter uses
Issues.Body:
Related:
   https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/38760

`BinaryFormatter` will be removed in .NET 5. Remove [its uses](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/search?l=C%23&q=binaryformatter&type=) with whatever drop-in replacement is provided in .NET 5.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove BinaryFormatter uses" (#1131)

Issues.Title: Improve CI Build Times
Issues.Body: Since #782, CI build times have gone up > 1hr. We need to improve CI build times and still retain some mechanism for running tests.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Improve CI Build Times" (#1121)

Issues.Title: Request: Placeholder support for the textbox control
Issues.Body:
This is a future feature request for the textbox control (and maybe others as well where this fits into) to have easy property support for a watermark / placeholder text. This is one of the most things you see in custom control WPF libraries. It should be easy to add to the source.

Please note that watermark also has been added to the winforms repo already https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/238 in case you may ask about the why. I could submit a PR but I'm not sure if that's too early as the WPF team may be too busy to work on the .NET Core 3 release for September?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Request: Placeholder support for the textbox control" (#1127)
